byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN
byline.contributor: Eric Lichtblau reported from Washington, and Joseph Goldstein from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Justice Department said a federal judge had erred in not ordering Apple to unlock a drug dealer’s iPhone, in a case being watched by lawyers and experts on both sides of the encryption debate.

headline.print_headline: Apple’s Win in Ruling on iPhone Is Appealed
headline.main: Justice Dept. Appeals Ruling in Apple iPhone Case in Brooklyn

snippet: The Justice Department said a federal judge had erred in not ordering Apple to unlock a drug dealer’s iPhone, in a case being watched by lawyers and experts on both sides of the encryption debate.
abstract: Justice Dept appeals decision by Federal Judge James Orenstein, who refused to order Apple to unlock drug dealer's iPhone in New York case; outcome may have important ramifications for similar case involving San Bernardino, Calif, gunman.
